radiographic_examinations.findings: massive confluent lymphadenopathy throughout the neck, chest, abdomen, and pelvis with markedly increased FDG uptake, as well as a massive right pleural effusion and a moderate left pleural effusion.
resolution of his left pleural effusion, small residual right pleural effusion, markedly decreased lymphadenopathy, and equivocal FDG uptake.

interval development of a large paraspinal mass extending from T6 through L1 and multiple abnormal mediastinal, retroperitoneal and mesenteric lymph nodes. Intense FDG-avidity was present in prevertebral, periaortic, retrocrural, and retroperitoneal masses.
